FuncDef:
The protocol-vlan vlan command associates interfaces with protocol-based VLANs.
The undo protocol-vlan vlan command deletes the association. The protocol-vlan vlan command associates interfaces with protocol-based VLANs. The undo protocol-vlan vlan command deletes the association. By default, no interface is associated with any VLAN. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: undo protocol-vlan { vlan <vlan-id> { all | <protocol-index1> [ to <protocol-index2> ] [ priority <priority> ] } }
ParentView: Layer 2 100GE interface view,Layer 2 10GE interface view,Layer 2 200GE interface view,25GE-L2 view,400GE-L2 view,Layer 2 50GE interface view,Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface view,Layer 2 GE interface view,Interface group view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of the VLAN classified based on protocols.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the index of a protocol template.
The value is an integer in the range 0 to 15.

Specifies the index of a protocol template.
The value is an integer in the range 0 to 15.

Specifies the 802.1p priority of the VLAN to be associated with the protocol.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. A larger value indicates a higher priority. The default value is 0.

ExtraInfo: After running the protocol-vlan <protoIdx1> command, you must run the protocol-vlan vlan command to associate the interface with the VLAN. After an interface is associated with a VLAN, the system automatically assigns the VLAN ID to the protocol when the associated protocol enters the interface.
